website_summaries.verdict: Attractive and durable alternative to wooden Adirondack chairs at an enticing price point. Patience is a virtue during assembly.
pros: Traditional Adirondack construction, not molded plastic
cons: Difficult to remove or reduce staining over time

customer_reviews.title: Beware of "warranty" comes with a catch
customer_reviews.text: "Lifetime" warranty on the chair...what they don't say is that you will have to disassemble said broken chair, somehow fit it back into the/a box and ship it back to them--regardless if chair is unusable. This was a purchase for my 82 year old father, how he is supposed to mangage this, I'm not sure. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not stain proof!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and weather, but they stain and can't be scrubbed clean. Perspiration (e.g., from someone wearing shorts) leaves a dark stain. Sunscreen leaves a white stain! See photo.
customer_reviews.author: WLH

customer_reviews.title: Loved these chairs for 6 months than one broke!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these chairs for 6 months than one broke! The Lifetime name is misleading. We were thinking about buying two more chairs, but will look for something that will last longer. My husband and I are not overweight or misuse them, it should have lasted longer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McReynolds

customer_reviews.title: OK for price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as an alternative to the $300 poly wood type. Out of the box the material feels a little cheap and I get the sense the other reviews claiming it gets brittle with time are probably spot on. I decided to paint mine to help protect them from the Florida sun, time will tell. I think if I had to do it over I would spend the extra coin in the real polywood.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Abe

customer_reviews.title: Not "easy assembly" - and Amazon not helpful
customer_reviews.text: Not "easy assembly"! The pre-drilled holes do not align well. Needs elbow grease, so unless you are very healthy (no back problems, no arthritis, etc.), you will have difficulties. Also, once you have started assembling but you want to return it, now you have to dissemble it! Please read the other 1-star reviews and decide for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: crazy over bunnies

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: I had so much trouble assembling this chair that I returned it. Many of the bolt holes will just not line up, no matter what you do. I have assembled dozens of DIY items over the years, so I consider myself to be very experienced in this area. I refuse to redrill new holes all over to get an item together. Also, it is made of lightweight plastic and I was not comfortable paying $150 for something that may not stand up to use over many years. I bought this chair on the recommendation of a neighbor. It is a nice looking chair once you get it together.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Finished product appears OK BUT assembly took 4 hours for 2 of us. We are BOTH experienced remodelers having done two bathrooms, a kitchen, home electric, etc. Rooms were stripped to the studs and re-made. Screws were too short, we had to use our own screws to complete assembly, screw holes did not match up, instructions were nebulous and drawings wrong. Complete POS regards to assembly!
customer_reviews.author: greg van stralen

customer_reviews.title: 3+ Years & Still a Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in December, 2016, to use poolside. Put them together & put them outside in January, 2017, & they have been sitting by the pool ever since. They get regular use as they are the most comfortable chairs we have for sitting. They have gone thru every season outdoors, snow, rain, sun, wind, bird droppings, etc., & are still going strong. Friends that are 300 lbs. plus have used them with no issue & we're thinking about buying 2 more since they have been such a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of box cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap material. Was broken out of the box. Bought two opened one box and sent both back. Don't waste your money on these
customer_reviews.author: Lshinerl

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you only want to use for a year or two.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after two years. Nice chair until it broke. just past the two year warranty, of course. Buy a polywood one. More expensive but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bring back the Whalers

customer_reviews.title: GOOD SOLID CHAIR and THE PRICE IS RIGHT
customer_reviews.text: I could write lengthy paragraphs but will be concise with short bullet points. [] Assemble the chair on a table if you can (it’s much easier) vs the floor [] About 70% of the chair comes already assembled...a big plus [] Some additional hand tools come in ‘big time’ handy [] Yes...you’ll need to drill some new pilot holes [] Imagines posted are self explanatory [] Don’t freak out...the chair does take work to assemble but any product of this nature takes work to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Tony Butcavage

customer_reviews.title: All Year 24/7
customer_reviews.text: I've had these chairs on my deck in rainy WA state for five years, never put them away. What else do you need to know? They are just as good, and sturdy as the day I bought them. I like real wood, as in cedar deck chairs, and I still have a few on the deck. I have to put them away in the rainy winter months, and have to treat them every year. Guess which ones I prefer? Hah! Good guess.
customer_reviews.author: George W

customer_reviews.title: The holes didn't line up at the base of one ...
customer_reviews.text: The holes didn't line up at the base of one of the connection points for one of the legs. I corrected it by drilling the holes. Two of the screws predrilled holes stripped out. You definitely needed two people to assemble this. I would only buy another if they dropped the price to around $80.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Manalus

customer_reviews.title: Sent with the wrong parts.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 chairs and they both came with two right arms. Didn’t know this until the last step of putting them together because arms are the last piece to attach. Waste of an hour and now have to call amazon and waste more time.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this product 3 years ago. Here are the issues you will face. #1 - it fades, #2 - one of the slats on the back has broken at the screw, and #3 - there customer service is terrible. Please be aware-lifetime does not mean a Lifetime warranty. The warranty they told me on this chair is 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Branden B.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: Cons: These are not easy to assemble. I had to get additional tools from the hardware store to finally succeed. Not easy at all. You need to be handy and persistent and psychologically prepared : ) They arrive scuffed so be aware they are not fancy. My porch is casual so it didn’t bother me too much. Pros: I like the color and at a glance they really look like real wood. They are comfortable and seem sturdy and durable enough. I like them.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, came broke and have not been able to contact customer service for 2 weeks now...
customer_reviews.text: These both came cracked and unusable and when I tried calling the customer number it constant said "higher than normal call volume". I've been currently getting that message for over a week straight and I've called everyday at least 15 times a day since these got delivered and have NEVER been able to talk to someone. I absolutely do not recommend. I don't even know how I am going to get replacement parts for these chairs when I can't even get a hold of the company.
customer_reviews.author: tanya

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful chairs.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice heavy substantial chairs. Took about 40 minutes to assemble. DO NOT tighten any screw before entire chair assembled. Will need to manipulate a bit for holes to line up. One chair went together easier than the other. Second chair I had one screw go in too deep and nothing would back it out. This second chair had some alignment issues so was very careful, but still had one loose cannon that didn’t have a stopping point. Plus two screws on the armrests would not sink all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Cali-kaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Still good but maybe not as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: I purchased eight of these four years ago and they have proven to be excellent! I added a new one to the set and found the quality to be very good except for the fasteners...they used to be high quality stainless steel and have been downgraded to a cheaper fastener. They work but I wonder what they will look like a few years from now in a wet environment. Sad that such a quality product was compromised for a relatively small cost saving.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but they go downhill
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about 4 years. I do not recall having any difficulty assembling them. I could tell that they were not very forgiving during assembly. It was like you got one chance at screwing in the screws. The chairs felt sturdy though. I started to notice after a year that they started to make creaking and cracking noises. I tried to retighten the screws, but I was afraid to strip them. I now have had two of the back supports break in half. They have not been abused. I now have 2 of 4 chairs broken. I will not be buying two replacements. They need to change the name from Lifetime to About 2 Years.
customer_reviews.author: maureen androsik

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase I made this summer!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this chair! It is comfortable, easy to care for and well-built and solid. It was not the easiest to put together with the allen wrench included, but only because the screws were tight and difficult to tighten. The instructions suggested having two people put the chair together. A good suggestion, but I was by myself and got it done. The end result was worth it. Be sure and watch the video and read the instructions BEFORE putting the chair together. If you tighten the screws before everything is assembled, you wont' get everything assembled. I would definitely buy this chair again. It was worth paying a little more for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult Assembly
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these chairs and it took hours to assemble them. And, it was difficult. One of the chairs never went together correctly and we had to sand down several pieces so they would fit together. I would have been much easier to buy them at a local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken leg in box
customer_reviews.text: Bought four of these and one of them had a broken left leg when I opened the box - broken right where the permanent screws were installed by the Manufacturer in Taiwan. Tried to glue it back together and we will see how it holds up until someone sends us a replacement leg...hopefully the shipper will? I'm concerned about the sturdiness of the chairs since a leg broke just during shipment without anyone sitting in it.
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: Junk!  Far from “Lifetime”
customer_reviews.text: In less than one year, SNAP! I’m a skinny guy (6’3”, 170 lbs) and this chair broke. I keep the chairs under chair covers and in the shade. The chairs are stored in the garage in the winter. I don’t think you can take much better care than I do. These chairs are expensive, I certainly thought they would last longer than one year. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: My Review,
customer_reviews.text: Box is very heavy and no doubt it is heavy duty! I use a drill gun to tighten the screws (uses a (oct head), if not I would be forever tightening the screws with my hand. We love the color and the heavy duty built. We just placed it in our pool area and purchase some heavy duty covers too. Great price too, we purchased two chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great and Comfortable Chairs
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, sturdy and comfortable chair. I purchased two chairs. Assembly was pretty easy but I had difficulty when assembling the arm rests...I recommend not tightening the screws on the arm supports until you get at least one screw installed on each end of the arm. Then install the rest of the screws and tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Nice chairs
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Adirondack chairs. Sturdy and comfortable. They look like they will hold up well. Difficult to put together. Very awkward if following directions. My grandson figured out a better way.
customer_reviews.author: April M. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Made well and came with good assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two of these chairs and I could not be happier. They are excellent quality and were packed well inside of the box. Adirondacks are not the easiest to assemble, so if you purchase two, assemble one then put the other one together the next day. They are outside on our deck, and they look beautiful. We are Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: MiaAthena

customer_reviews.title: I simply love the chair
customer_reviews.text: I simply love the chair! Easy to assemble, good looking and very comfortable. But, if I had noticed that the PART IDENTIFICATION STICKERS were paper and mucilage and not peel 'n stick I would have returned the product. Impossible to remove without damage to the product. Perfect example of bean counter mentality interfering with product design trying to save a few mils without purpose. They're so easy to assemble I may still return them
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Time consuming assembly
customer_reviews.text: Out of 4 chairs, 2 had significant issues with the preaassembled sections requiring disassembly and reassembly. Made quite a chore. They should figure out how to use all same length screw because I’d you accidentally grab a long screw for a short area, it WILL drill right through the other side of the wood.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful chair.
customer_reviews.text: This is just a beautiful chair. I bought this in late fall so I have not really had the opportunity to use it fully yet. I also purchased the covering for this so hopefully next spring I will really get to test this. It took me a while to put this together, but hey, I am 68 and a single female that needs to learn how to do this stuff, and I eventually got it together. Instructions were a little less than perfect too. Finish is beautiful and I will be caring for this like one cares for a jewel.
customer_reviews.author: midwest spin

customer_reviews.title: Previous Lifetime Adirondack chairs were good so these probably will be
customer_reviews.text: We havent put these together yet but 4 of the exact same Lifetime chairs we bought a few years ago at Costco arte still doing well - still sturdy, little or no fading. So these should do well as long as they didn't change anything at the plant in Taiwan/China (which unfortunately does happen. quality can vary as they cut costs or switch vendors)
customer_reviews.author: RangerRick

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chair
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable chair for the price. Also appears durable to the weather. Did take some time to put together 2 of these chairs but the 2nd one was much easier to assemble after the first chair. All parts were in the box. You may want to purchase a 5/32 hex bit to make the assembly a little easier than a standard wrench included with the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Don't over-tighten the screws
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably-priced, well made and sturdy, these chairs should last a lifetime.Be sure to leave all screws a bit loose until final assembly, you'll need to line up the predrilled holes to the target divots(and some targets are a bit off pattern). Once fully assembled and tightened these are sturdy and comfortable. I added outdoor chair glides to save scraping these heavy chairs across the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We were very pleased with the quality of these chairs and they are very comfortable to sit in. Putting them together took some time but after the first one the second one went much faster. We like that they are fade resistance and not made of real wood so they will last much longer out in the weather.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I would rate these chairs very good to excellent
customer_reviews.text: I would rate these chairs very good to excellent. The chairs were fairly easy to assembly, they are very comfortable, but we have only been using them for a little over a month, so I am not sure about the durability. One thing for sure, is having the chairs has opened the door for me and my wife being outside more...when the sand gnats allow us. So, that alone is a positive thing!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: I had one heck of a time trying to put this chair together! I was supposed to come with 4 long screws and I got 6. Therefore, I had to use 2 of the long screws in places they didn't belong so they stick way out. It also showed finger prints all over it when it was finally complete. If it wouldn't have been such a difficult item to return, I would have returned it. I do not recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Dar

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Now that the chairs are assembled, I love them! Assembly was a little challenging but once I decided that I needed to use my drill versus the little tool that was include, assembly was much easier. Also a shout-out to their service department for great customer service when I needed to call for a replacement part when I messed up a piece. They were great.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Graham

customer_reviews.title: QC Lacking but Nice Chair
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two chairs, one arrived with a broken part. Definitely factory damage opposed to shipping damage. Poor QC since the damage clearly occurred at factory while putting together the pre-screwed parts of the chair. Contacted the company but no response yet, will update accordingly. Very happy with the one chair that I was able to put together. Seems sturdy and looks like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Pennsylvania

customer_reviews.title: use a power screw driver. Assemble loosely and tighten after fully assembled
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and weatherproof. I needed to open up the predrilled holes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Krechevsky

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised ... No Surprises
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, well-packaged, no broken or missing pieces. Simple assembly ... 15 minutes tops. Some of the predrilled holes are not aligned. Most are ... but the ones that aren't are off by at least 1/2". No big deal to CAREFULLY drill other pilot holes...just deep enough to get the screws started. They look great. In fact, you have to look really closely to figure out it's not wood ... and even then it's a little hard to tell. Ordering 2 more today.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered
customer_reviews.text: Impressive chairs! I bought two in order to confirm the quality was good. I may have overrated them for longevity since I just assembled them, but from what I can tell they will go the distance. The top part of the chair is flexible too so it bounces slightly if you bounce your head off of it.
customer_reviews.author: JBCin

customer_reviews.title: Solid and weather proof
customer_reviews.text: So I read reviews before buying these about how difficult the assembly was. Nonsense..it took about 20 mins per chair only because there are a lot of quality stainless steel screws to install. Definitely use a drill. I did have one hole that didn't quite line up..a quick hit with a drill bit took care of that.
customer_reviews.author: Calidad

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 chairs. All four chairs had pieces that the pre-drilled holes did not line up. It took a lot longer to assemble due to that. Some never did and now I am concerned about the long term sturdiness of chairs. One chair came with a cracked wood piece on the seat. It is impossible to just call customer service. I tried every number available. I finally submitted to an on line request to replace broken board. The color wood does not always match. These are definitely not the quality of other faux wood chairs I have seen. I will report back at end of summer on how they held up and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: James Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: We Love These Chairs
customer_reviews.text: We live in Southern New Hampshire, and we're going into our 3rd year of ownership. These chairs outside year round and are holding up fine. We've used them daily and couldn't be more satisfied. For the money, I feel the are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Gene C. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Nice chairs. - Excellent  support from Lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Take your time assembling. Line up the holes with a pair of awls and use a good ratcheting screwdriver (SnapOn for example) to drive the screws. Well packed but two of ours had some minor damage in shipment. Lifetime was very responsive in providing needed replacements. The chairs are quite comfortable and a nice addition around our fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Sawbuck

customer_reviews.title: Quality control needs some attention.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two chairs and assembly is very easy to assemble to the last part, attaching the arm rest. It is hit or miss if they actually line up correctly. One chair was fine the other was off by a half inch or so.
customer_reviews.author: JohnA

customer_reviews.title: NOT so easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: First, the pre drilled holes were off on 30% of the chair. We had to tap new holes or struggle with trying to force the screws in. Second, one piece was chipped right where the pre drilled hole was. We had it almost put together, so no going back! Tried wood glue. We will see of that works. Lifetime? With glue? Probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and sturdy chairs
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are very attractive in our outdoor patio space. I was a little nervous to order these based on multiple reviews that they are hard to assemble. My husband had no trouble assembling two chairs, and he is usually not a handyman.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: great chairs
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to assemble as they should be, but not terribly difficult
customer_reviews.author: Bill M

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy read description for assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Great chairs to relax in. Would have been 5stars but these buggers are hard to put together. Make sure to have a ratcheting screwdriver with Allen bit. Makes things a whole lot easier than the Allen wrench provided. All in all very happy with the purchase. These will replace my wood, rotted, Adirondack chair from the past
customer_reviews.author: Richard van Gelder

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy, but not the type of recycled plastic I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: These are made of a fiberglass and polystyrene plastic resin. They are heavy and hard to move around, much heavier than real wood or ones made of recycled milk jug plastic (polyethylene plastic). You'd think heavier means more heavy duty, but I don't know if these will last since they are so brittle.
customer_reviews.author: SharePoint Blackbelt

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love these chairs
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love these chairs! purchased two a while ago for my nephew and they still look like new. just purchased two more for my new house. they are comfortable to sit in and are good quality materials. my only problem was that I assembled the first one in the house and then had trouble getting in through my sliding door. didn't make that mistake the second time. lol.
customer_reviews.author: melinda kelley

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for one person to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult for one person to assemble. Instruction booklet mentioned. Get someone to help you. I was on my own. Last step was to tighten all screws. My last tighten was on the screws on the backrest. Three, one on one panel, two on another would not hold. I now have to call manufacturer. Hope there is not a lot of red tape.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bellistri

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these chairs.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd chair I have purchased. The 1st one has weathered fl hurricanes, and many rain storms. I put them both together myself. They are sturdy, Comfortable. They look like wood. They. donot fade and are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: hiddenside

customer_reviews.title: Arrived slightly damaged
customer_reviews.text: It came with a small part broken. It was small enough it’s not worth returning, I think I can glue it together. It also had one slat that was kind of faded. But I’m going to order again and hope maybe it was a fluke it arrived slightly damaged. It is comfortable and I’d like a set bec is that. Please take more care in packaging the chair please.
customer_reviews.author: Joi

customer_reviews.title: Chair appears to be of good quality. Can't beat the price although my wife ...
customer_reviews.text: Just put the chair together last week. I was shocked by the number of screws and bolts I had to install my self. An Allen wrench was provided, but a bit for a drill would have been welcomed. Takes a while to assemble the chair. Chair appears to be of good quality. Can't beat the price although my wife said that BJ is selling them for $20 less than through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Yves Pollart

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: We did a lot of research and landed on this chair. I was a little concerned because I'm a bigger guy (6'-1" , 270) and I wasn't sure they would be big enough, but they work great. Another big plus was the no-maintenance factor. Really couldn't be happier w the purchase, bought 6 of them to go around our fire-pit and they look great. Took about 20 to 25 minutes to put together - not hard, but would recommend a cordless drill with a Allen chuck to speed things up - keep it on a low power setting because you can strip out the screw if not careful
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and made to last
customer_reviews.text: I love these chairs. We've had one set for 4+ years that still look new after staying outside year round. We just bought another set for the lake house.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.M.

customer_reviews.title: QA needs some work
customer_reviews.text: This is the fifth chair of this model we have bought for our yard to replace wooden chairs, over the last five years. No failures of the product has occurred, shipment packaging is robust and of comprehensive design. My only observation (other than the wrong part) its that I believe the SS Screws provide for general assembly could be sightly longer for a better grip in the plastic core of the faux wood sections. Fifth chair came packed with two Right arms, have requested proper arm from vendor. (see Pictures)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Broken seat slats when opened. Good chair, Bad quality assurance
customer_reviews.text: Item came quick and chairs seem to be good quality. The slats on the assembled seat of the chair were cracked in 3 places around the screw heads. Someone missed their quality check My wife said no return, we just glued it together, rather than dealing with the return process. the use of a different tool is recommended. The allen they give you is very small.
customer_reviews.author: Francy Reigert

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime name doesn’t mean a lifetime warranty. Light brown color is more orange than I’d like.
customer_reviews.text: For use on our decks. The color isn’t quite natural looking, but not so bad that I want to return. We sat in the same style chairs on vacation and liked them, was impressed by the thought, implied by the name, Lifetime. Be warned, there is no Lifetime warranty, only two years. We will see how they hold up. Right now we are quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality - avoid.
customer_reviews.text: We had to return 2 of these - the quality was extremely poor and parts were missing, making assembly difficult. I would not recommend this product. For the price, the material quality and “fit” of the assembled parts should be nearly perfect. It’s far from that. Nothing fits together properly and the chair feels much cheaper than it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: JD - Memphis

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime does not stand behind this product
customer_reviews.text: Came with a broken slat. For support, Amazon pointed me to Lifetime. Lifetime pointed me to Amazon. It was a Lifetime issue (shipping container was not damaged at all) and they would not replace the slat. It also took them 19 days to respond to a simple request. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thom

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: This most recent purchase was the fourth one of these chairs we have bought. I was worried the older ones (2-3 years old) may have faded and the new one would not match. But this was not an issue - they all look the same, even after the older ones sat outside in a Minnesota winter last year.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. Not easy to put together. One was better to do as the parts lined up. The other, not so much. It required me to 'bend' the precut arm and I was concerned it might snap so I had to go millimeter by millimeter and finally, using a pry bar and clamp to line up the pre-drilled holes it was together. It required a lot of skill. Are there trolls at these factories that drill holes that don't line up and smirk as it is put in the box?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. First one was a pain to put together. But we learned from first one and the second one was put together in half the time of the first one. Very sturdy. Ours are outdoors all the time. No signs of wear or decay. Nice chairs. I would buy more if I had the room.
customer_reviews.author: nancy sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Wood is easily stained
customer_reviews.text: For faux wood it stains VERY EASILY. Its repels water a little but acts like RAW wood not finished. It almost acts like it needs a finish to it. Also, the screws strip very easily on assembly.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair but the Material scuffs very easily
customer_reviews.text: Assembling this chair is an exercise in pure frustration. Whoever pre drilled the holes for the screws must have been on drugs. The holes don't line up at all so I eventually had to just drill my own holes. Nice chair but the Material scuffs very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Staza

customer_reviews.title: Broken when opened
customer_reviews.text: The chairs came and 3 out of the 4 were cracked or broken. We were having a party the next day and I had to use wood glue and try to make it work. It doesn’t look the best and doubt it will hold up. Very disappointed with the product and stuck since I unpackaged it all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Packaging by manufacturer is a little iffy!
customer_reviews.text: The verdict is still out as I received the packages today for the three chairs I ordered and a number of the pieces were scratched. It seems to be due to the way the manufacturer packages the boxes (see pictures). Called Amazon customer service and they were amazing. Already have replacements on the way. Hope that the same issue doesn’t occur. I do think in the end these will look great around our fire pit as the style and color are perfect. Update - Amazon quickly sent us replacements and we are now using the chairs. Assembly was made easier by not using the hex key they provided and utilizing a more user friendly tool. Very pleased with the chairs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 of these chairs over the last two years. We leave them out year- round. They have held up well in Vermont winters. Faded slightly but that's expected. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Reed

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had there chairs since summer of 2017, they are comfortable and sturdy and weather well in a New England coastal town.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: A great, well built chair!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of these chairs on my deck for over a year and they're holding up great. They've been outdoors 24/7 for the last year in the sun and rain with no visible wear. I purchased two more and they are the same, well-built quality. I cut the hex tool and used my power drill to speed up the assembly process. They're sturdy and good looking. I expect them to last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Chairs
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two. Assembly was difficult for, even for two. Great chairs. Intend to purchase four more of the same. Very sturdy. Very thick poly wood. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mjlee

customer_reviews.title: Return was easy and replacement was shipped immediately
customer_reviews.text: First delivery arrived with several broken pieces. Return was easy and replacement was shipped immediately. Second delivery was in perfect condition. Assembly was relatively easy but greatly expedited by a cordless screwdriver. Be aware that there approximately 45 screws that must be inserted. There is an allen wrench included but the thought of using this to assemble this chair is the stuff of nightmares. When assembled the chair is sturdy and looks good. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Harrison

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets for an Adirondack chair.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking chair. Very easy to put together. The wood is a composite that is used in other Lifetime products. My experience is it wear much, much better than really wood. Plus, no staining necessary and no splinters to worry about. I've used mine for a year and it still looks new. I get lots of compliment with this chair.
customer_reviews.author: YouMaybeRightIMaybeCrzy

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble and due to it, stress the final product
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to assemble. Predeilled tap screw pilot holes mostly are not aligned. Additionally It uses stiff fabricated material. It makes the alignment worse when you try to fasten them. Need at least one muscle guy to do this assembly. Due to the mis-alignment of pilot holes , the assembly will stress the material and weaken the strength of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Put two chairs together in 2 hours, easy to follow instructions. Heavy chairs so they won't blow over in wind or tip over with kids climbing on them. Price fluctuates so watch for best deal. Waiting for price to drop to buy 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these chairs and the accompanying table and love them! Well built and sturdy. I love the material
customer_reviews.author: Gary Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly comfortable. The plastic material is denser and more brittle feeling than I expected, but the overall quality is great. The chair is heavy and feels worth the price. I used an electric driver for assembly or it would have taken hours.
customer_reviews.author: P. Waydo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding 4th one. Hold up very well. Not difficult to assemble, but don't lose any screws, you have NO EXTRAS.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Dan Ayars

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and high quality. Only negative is they are very heavy. But they are extremely sturdy and at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Larry S

customer_reviews.title: I love these chairs
customer_reviews.text: I love these chairs. They take some effort to put together but worth the effort. I have to say that I find this to be a quality item. I don't much like the comfort of any type of Adirondack chair. I just don't like them but others seem to love them so I bought these. I'm so glad I did. They are very good quality and they look so nice around my fire pit on my patio and are at the ready-to-serve. Buy them. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Lil

customer_reviews.title: Love these chairs
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for over a year around a fire pit. They are very comfortable and durable. They have held up to rain sun and snow without fading or really showing any wear. They go together pretty easily. They do melt if you touch them with a hot (marshmallow fork) tip or stick.
customer_reviews.author: James P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: What a win! Amazing quality and already half assembled. Easy to follow instructions and meticulous packing and even the screws were in a tidy organized tray! Very pleased especially for the price with these. Also very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan E.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but a bit of a challenge to put together
customer_reviews.text: It is a beautiful and sturdy chair, but a nightmare to put together. It shouldn't be that hard given the few pieces, but the holes did not line up and the pre-drilled holes are very small compared to the size of the screws with awkward angles needed to assemble. Have patience, a drill and a flashlight handy. I'd also recommend having 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaLee

customer_reviews.title: assembly is difficult
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy chair. Assembly really requires an electric driver. The allen wrench supplied is not up to the task. Too many difficult screws to put in at awkward angles.
customer_reviews.author: RGL

customer_reviews.title: sittin' in style!
customer_reviews.text: i went back and forth about which adirondak to order. my artsy self wanted the traditional wooden chair, perhaps with a splash of vibrant color... but i ordered this one and am pleased as punch that i did. it looks like a wooden adirondak. the arm rests are wide enough to support my latest summer read and the chair is comfy enough to wile away the hours with book in hand and an ice cold lemonade. worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: sloughliving

customer_reviews.title: For the most part this is a nice deal, it cost's less than the wooden versions ...
customer_reviews.text: For the most part this is a nice deal, it cost's less than some of the wooden versions and it looks real good, plus its maintenance free. The only thing I dont like is when it's being assembled, if you make the screws too tight....crack goes the plastic! So be careful when you put it together
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This chair was half the cost of a comparable chair. It is sturdy and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Huberoy123

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 a couple years ago and loved them. Just bought 2 more. They last and are durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but they're very comfortable and after a year in the sun
customer_reviews.text: The color wasn't exactly as expected, but they're very comfortable and after a year in the sun, haven't faded or cracked in the slightest. Beware—there are a LOT of allen screws and the fit is surprisingly tight, so bring a drill with the right allen bit. Do not attempt to put this together by hand! I wanted to surprise my wife the next day and didn't want to wake the neighbors with my drill. Ended up spending *hours* with a little allen wrench and my hands wanted to kill me the next day. Totally worth it, tho'.
customer_reviews.author: The Audacity Works

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Adirondack Chair
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful looking chair I thought it was wood when I first saw it, comfortable and study. You have to be careful putting it together and not over tighten screws. I have been very happy with lifetime products. Nov 2017 These chairs have been left out everyday since I have owned them and they still look great, they do not look plastic, I love them.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lonsdale

customer_reviews.title: this chair sits in the hot sun and has been exposed to the elements all year long and it still looks great. Outstanding value at $129
customer_reviews.text: One year later, this chair sits in the hot sun and has been exposed to the elements all year long and it still looks great. Outstanding value at $129.00 but the price has now increased to $150. I'll buy one more.
customer_reviews.author: Tomar

customer_reviews.title: Great chairs for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of the chairs and I love the way they look..They are comfortable and sturdy..The only problem we had was the holes did not all line up when putting the chairs together. We had to drill 3 new holes in one chair and 1 in another..the other two chairs were fine. Once we drilled the new holes we were able to assemble the chairs so we are all set. I plan to order another 2 chairs.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn k walley

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair, Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great chair!! Take your time during assembly and read the instructions carefully. Only tighten bolts when told to do so. If I would have done that, would have saved a bunch of time. Life and learn!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable product
customer_reviews.text: Very durable product. Our chairs have been outside for about 16 months now in northern Wisconsin. Summer, winter, and everything in between.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L Pfohl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chairs
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had these chairs almost 1.5 years now. They stay outside through 4 seasons, and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Love these chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to see how I would like it. Loved it!!! So I bought 3 more. These chairs are great. They look like real wood but should wheather much better than wood. Very sturdy design.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Who

product_meta.title: Lifetime Faux Wood Adirondack Chair, Brown - 60064
product_meta.description: Style:Chair| Color:BrownCreate the ideal outdoor living space with the Adirondack Chair from Lifetime Products. Constructed of weather-resistant Polystyrene, the chair is UV protected and designed for outdoor use. Unlike wooden furniture, the simulated wood will not splinter, warp or rot and never needs to be painted or varnished. So enjoy an afternoon relaxing with family and friends with the Adirondack Chair from Lifetime Products. The weight capacity is 300 pounds,slat thickness is 0.64 inches,chair width is 31.1 inches and the armrest thickness is 0.75 inches
feature_bullets: Classic comfortable design; Constructed of weather-resistant simulated wood
UV-protected will not crack, chip or peel
Some assembly required. Please watch assembly video
Stain resistant and easy to clean. Seat Length - 38.6 inch.(98 cm). Seat Back Height - 36.9 inc.(93.7 cm)
The beauty of wood without the maintenance

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,048 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
